    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Augur</h1>These spherical monsters made of sinewy muscle, serrated blades, and bloody metal are the most common velstracs on the Shadow Plane. Each augur has only a single eye, from which it can see the horrors inflicted upon it by other velstracs, who train the augur to expect and appreciate pain. Augurs are 1 foot in diameter and weigh 30 pounds.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 17<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=460">Augur</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 1</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Augur.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Augur.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Tiny" class="traitsize" title="Tiny">Tiny</span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><span alt="Velstrac Trait" class="trait" title="<i>Note from Nethys: no description was provided for this trait</i>"><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=265">Velstrac</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 82</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +8; darkvision, painsight<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=21"><u>Shadowtongue</a></u>; can't speak any language<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +7, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +4, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Torture Lore</a></u> +7<br /><b>Str</b> -1, <b>Dex</b> +3, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +2, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> -1<br /><b>Painsight</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=47">divination</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>) A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=11">dying</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42">wounded</a> conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.<hr /><b>AC</b> 17, <b>Fort</b> +4, <b>Ref</b> +10, <b>Will</b> +7<br /><b>HP</b> 14, regeneration 2 (deactivated by good or silver); <b>Immunities</b> cold; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 5, silver 5<br /><b>Unnerving Gaze</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=68">fear</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=163">visual</a>) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it feels the sharp barbs of the augur’s blades on its skin. The creature must succeed at a DC 17 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened 1</a> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened 2</a> on a critical failure).<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet, fly 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> blade +8 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile P</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4-1 slashing plus 1d4 persistent bleed</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 17; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=247">read omens</a></u></i> (once per week); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=15">augury</a></u></i> (x2); <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=146">harm</a></u></i> (x3); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(1st)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=177">mage hand</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Focus Gaze</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=68"><u>fear</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=163"><u>visual</a></u>) The augur stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the augur’s unnerving gaze. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the augur’s next turn.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Whirling Slice</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  The augur Flies or Strides, whirling as it moves. The augur deals the damage of its blade Strike to each creature whose space it enters (DC 16 basic Reflex save). Each creature is affected only once, even if the augur moves through its space multiple times.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=460">Augur</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=461">Evangelist</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=462">Interlocutor</a></td><td>12</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=463">Precentor</a></td><td>16</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 82</i></a><br />Velstracs are horrific, shadow-dwelling fiends who seek ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of debasement and torture before then turning their knives on themselves. Although velstracs consider themselves beyond such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict debased, sadistic suffering. They claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don’t recognize any refinement that doesn’t require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.<br /><br /> Velstracs manifest from the souls of masochistic or sadistic mortals that are diverted into the Shadow Plane and then forged into forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the aesthetics-obsessed interlocutors.<br /><br /> Some mortals refer to velstracs as “kytons,” a misattribution that the velstracs tolerate with cold amusement. The term “kyton” denotes a master or virtuoso among their kind, and these fiends enjoy being labeled masters of their horrid paths to perfection through agony.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Despicable Origins</h3>Velstracs originated with the first debased thoughts of mortals, which the gods found so deplorable that they locked all velstracs away in Hell. It wasn’t long, however, before the newly formed race of velstracs escaped their infernal prison to the Shadow Plane.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Velstracs</h3>Scholars grimly joke that there are as many different kinds of velstracs as there are ways to skin a cat. The relatively diminutive cantor velstrac poisons the minds of its victims so that they believe they are being clawed from the inside out. The mighty eremites, on the other hand, seek out the most powerful beings to subsume into their own form and lord over all other velstracs save the demagogues.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> The Shadow Forge</h3>Many velstracs forge their own chains, but others outsource the task to unique velstracs known as almoners. These blind, deaf, and mute velstracs resemble six-armed halflings severed at the waist that toil away endlessly at a great burning foundry called the Shadow Forge. Almoners operate under mysterious strictures, and are just as likely to turn a velstrac away empty-handed as they are to hand one a finely crafted chain before the request has even been uttered.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Velstrac Divinities</h3>The most powerful velstracs are unique divinities known collectively as demagogues—powerful creatures often worshipped by mortals who seek to experience agonizing new revelations and gain power by enhancing the body through pain.</span>

    <br />

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
